Suit.definition: a proceeding to enforce a right or claim ;specif
Suit.origin: [Anglo-French siute suite suit request to initiate legal proceedings, literally, pursuit, from siute , feminine past participle of suire to follow, from Old French sivre see sue ]

1.1: a proceeding to enforce a right or claim

2.1: an action brought in a court seeking a remedy for injuries suffered or a determination of rights
